org.cripac.isee.vpe.common

Class Stream

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cripac.isee.vpe.common.Stream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DataManagingApp.PedestrainTrackletAttrRetrievingStream, DataManagingApp.PedestrainTrackletRetrievingStream, DataManagingApp.SavingStream, MessageHandlingApp.MessageHandlingStream, PedestrianAttrRecogApp.RecogStream, PedestrianReIDUsingAttrApp.ReIDStream, PedestrianTrackingApp.RTVideoStreamTrackingStream, PedestrianTrackingApp.VideoFragmentTrackingStream 

    public abstract class Stream
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A Stream is a flow of DStreams. Each stream outputs at most one INPUT_TYPE of output.

    Created by ken.yu on 16-10-26.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Stream.Info
      The Info class is designed to force the output data INPUT_TYPE to be assigned to a stream, so that INPUT_TYPE matching checking can be conducted.

      • buildBytesParRecvStream

        protected org.apache.spark.streaming.api.java.JavaPairDStream<java.lang.String,byte[]> buildBytesParRecvStream(@Nonnull
                                                                                                               org.apache.spark.streaming.api.java.JavaStreamingContext streamingContext,
                                                                                                               int numRecvStreams,
                                                                                                               @Nonnull
                                                                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> kafkaParams,
                                                                                                               @Nonnull
                                                                                                               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> numPartitionsPerTopic)
        Utilization function for all applications to receive messages with byte array values from Kafka in parallel.
        Parameters:
        streamingContext - The streaming context of the applications.
        numRecvStreams - Number of streams to use for parallelization.
        kafkaParams - Parameters for reading from Kafka.
        numPartitionsPerTopic - A map specifying topics to read from, each assigned number of partitions for the topic.
        Returns:
        A paralleled Kafka receiver input stream.

      • buildBytesDirectStream

        protected org.apache.spark.streaming.api.java.JavaPairDStream<java.lang.String,byte[]> buildBytesDirectStream(@Nonnull

                                                                                                              @Nonnull
                                                                                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> numPartitionsPerTopic)
        Utility function for all applications to receive messages with byte array values from Kafka with direct stream.
        Parameters:
        streamingContext - The streaming context of the applications.
        kafkaParams - Parameters for reading from Kafka.
        numPartitionsPerTopic - A map specifying topics to read from, each assigned number of partitions for the topic.
        Returns:
        A Kafka non-receiver input stream.
